title: GAD-7 (General Anxiety Disorder-7)
description: Measures anxiety severity and screens for generalized anxiety disorder

parameters.name: nervous_anxious_on_edge
parameters.description: Feeling nervous, anxious, or on edge (over the past 2 weeks)

parameters.name: not_able_stop_control_worrying
parameters.description: Not being able to stop or control worrying (over the past 2 weeks)

parameters.name: worrying_too_much_different_things
parameters.description: Worrying too much about different things (over the past 2 weeks)

parameters.name: being_so_restless
parameters.description: Being so restless that it's hard to sit still (over the past 2 weeks)

parameters.name: becoming_easily_annoyed_irritable
parameters.description: Becoming easily annoyed or irritable (over the past 2 weeks)

parameters.name: feeling_afraid_something_awful
parameters.description: Feeling afraid as if something awful might happen (over the past 2 weeks)

ranges.interpretation: Minimal anxiety. No intervention necessary. Routine monitoring may be appropriate.
Mild anxiety. Monitor symptoms and provide reassurance. Consider stress management techniques.
Moderate anxiety. Possible clinically significant condition. Further assessment and/or referral to mental health professional recommended.
Severe anxiety. Active treatment probably warranted. Strongly recommend referral to mental health professional and consider psychotherapy and/or pharmacotherapy.

references: Spitzer RL, Kroenke K, Williams JB, Löwe B. A brief measure for assessing generalized anxiety disorder: the GAD-7. Arch Intern Med. 2006;166(10):1092-7. doi: 10.1001/archinte.166.10.1092.

Löwe B, Decker O, Müller S, et al. Validation and standardization of the Generalized Anxiety Disorder Screener (GAD-7) in the general population. Med Care. 2008;46(3):266-74. doi: 10.1097/MLR.0b013e318160d093.

Plummer F, Manea L, Trepel D, McMillan D. Screening for anxiety disorders with the GAD-7 and GAD-2: a systematic review and diagnostic metaanalysis. Gen Hosp Psychiatry. 2016;39:24-31. doi: 10.1016/j.genhosppsych.2015.11.005.
formula: Sum of scores for all 7 items (each scored 0-3 points)
notes: Assesses anxiety symptoms over the past 2 weeks
Score ≥10 indicates need for further mental health assessment
Score ≥8 may indicate probable generalized anxiety disorder (sensitivity 92%, specificity 76%)
Also screens for panic disorder, social anxiety disorder, and PTSD with good accuracy
Quick screening tool suitable for primary care settings
Does not replace comprehensive psychiatric evaluation
Consider cultural and linguistic factors when interpreting results
Monitor changes over time to assess treatment response
